Reviews.Author: Amelinda
Reviews.Content: I want to say I've been here three times between the end of last year up to this past May. The good part is that every trip was great! I was really, really skeptical when my co-workers informed me of a  good  sushi joint in Anthem, so it took them a while to convince me to take a trip here. I'm definitely glad they did.   What's different from other sushi restaurants is probably the most important. I like that they have several, really delicious, no-rice sushi options. Very cool for those that want to watch their carb intake (diabetics!). Also, this is a non-AYCE sushi joint. Not everyone's cup of tea, but I think that attributes to the freshness and quality of fish.  My favorite no-rice dishes are the Spring Mountain Roll (spicy soft shell crab, shrimp tempura, avocado, radish sprout, eel, wrapped in rice paper, topped with spicy mayo and sriracha) and the Screaming Orgasm (tuna sashimi or seared, lots of julienned daikon, sauces galore, tobbiko, green onions). The Spring Mountain Roll is probably my overall favorite sushi roll. The last time I was there, the chefs gave us a bowl of tempura jalape√±o. Not something I would ever order, but they were so good! And not terribly spicy either.   My only gripe was the terrible quality of the Ikura on my last visit. It was not good. But, to their defense, I hardly find really delicious Ikura or Uni in the valley. Other than that, it's just really busy during dinner. Service is usually pretty good, no complaints, but nothing amazing.  Overall, great place for a sushi fix!

Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Finally.  After trying about half a dozen sushi joints in town, I think my wife and I found one we will go back to regularly.  I Love Sushi gained instant credibility because a.) it was actually crowded when we went there (on a Monday no less) and b.) they didn't have some incredibly priced ala carte menu to entice you into their  all you can eat  offering.  I think my wife and I would each get our rolls again (I Love Sushi roll, The Mistake roll, some roll that had the word  nipple  in it, and another one I forget the name of).  The highlight for me was the sashimi.  For $5 the portion was great.  Three very thick pieces of salmon and incredibly dark/fresh tuna.  The salmon was delicious and maybe the best salmon sashimi I've had, same for the tuna.  In the words Ahhhnold,  I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: This is the sushi place my friend takes me to whenever I'm in Las Vegas for a visit. On each occassion I've sat at the bar and the service has always been excellent and the quality of the fish has always been very good. They are prompt in making the sushi and the wait staff immediately clears the plate once you've finished. There is almost a factory like quality to the service in terms of efficiency. Although I haven't personally experienced, but my friend tells me that this  efficiency  also makes this place a bit undesireable if you just want to sit at a table and have a leisurely dinner. If your table finishes their plates and are just hanging out, it's almost guranteed that they will be politely asked to allow the wait staff to clear the table for a following reservation.

Reviews.Author: Wesley
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite sushi restaurant. I go here with my family probably once a month. So good! I recommend Tastes Like My Ex-girlfriend and Something Wrong # 69. Nummers.  The service is fast. Sometimes almost too fast. Hard to explain that one... I guess sometimes it's nice to have the rolls brought out more gradually.  I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Christian
Reviews.Content: Awsome sushi, fresh and fast. I would go back over and over. The prices are high but thats to be expected from a place like this one. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: When in Vegas and you have time to get away from the strip - this is the sushi place to eat at!   They have a large variety of rolls, all the fish taste very fresh. Service is great, our server was prompt and checked in with us frequently. Can't wait to come back and try more of their rolls, I'm sure they are all delicious!

Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: I will definitely venture out here again when we visit Las Vegas! Everything was delicious and the place was packed but we didn't have to wait long. The sashimi salad has an amazing dressing. Their rolls maybe a little too much sauce on it but other than that a super yum sushi experience!!

Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: I love the atmosphere here - it's always rockin busy so you know the fish has to be fresh!. The sushi bar is huge and the booths are big and private. All the waitresses are friendly and very attentive. They wear stylish colorful Kimonos! It is absolutely family friendly - this is by far my favorite sushi place in all of Vegas / Henderson! People travel from all over town to eat here! They have very sexy & fun names for their sushi rolls! Coldest beers in town - large sapporro - fav!! My favorite rolls you have to order:  #1 Screaming Orgasm - Tuna with radishes that are cut like angel hair - good for low carb orders! #2 Kiss of Fire ( It's a little Spicy- if you prefer not spicy - just say no sauce- the little sliver of jalapeno on top is fresh so not very spicy) #3 Johnny Roll No Rice - Refreshing! #4 Sushi Nachos - Unlike anything you have ever had! Pure deliciousness! #5 Anthem roll - traditional Calif roll with spicy tuna on top. #6 Ryan's Special or Double D #7 Caterpillar Roll  This place is busy from open to close! Call ahead to get a reservation!

Reviews.Author: craig
Reviews.Content: Old staple in the hood, great atmosphere. always high energy and hard to not run into someone you know every time. All the guys @ the sushi bar are fun and personable. good sushi great variety.  Always finish with the oyster shooter.

Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: When in Henderson/Vegas, this sushi joint is hands down the best there is.  Some of the names can't be written or repeated here (when you see the menu, you will understand) but I had two different ones that were killer.    Tip:  Ask for the Natto Hand Roll.  It's not on menu but you know you have a authentic Japanese Sushi Bar when they have Natto.  Cash and Credit Cards accepted.

Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite sushi place that I have been coming to consistently since 2003, the best sushi town in my opinion, love that most of the people working here are still the same people since I starting coming in 2003, great atmosphere, great sushi bar, this place is always great and never disappoints

Reviews.Author: Kay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to this place several times and we love  I Love Sushi !    The food is always fresh, fast and great tasting...equally important is the stellar service we consistantly receive from the girls dressed in their traditional geisha garb.  I can't say enough great things about this place!!

Reviews.Author: Monica
Reviews.Content: My favorite sushi in Las Vegas. Hilarious menu names, delicious food, great service!

Reviews.Author: Susie
Reviews.Content: Residents in the Anthem\Seven Hills area are SO lucky! This place is easily the best sushi in the desert especially for the price. Quality, Freshness, and Service are always top notch. It's so hard to go to an AYCE joint shortly after I Love Sushi, you notice a BIG difference right away.   I had frequented this place to the point of exhaustion back when I lived in Henderson. Now, living over 20 miles away, I crave it almost every month and MUST make the trip over. The variety of rolls makes it easy to find something that combines every kind of sushi you enjoy (i.e. Mistake Roll). The service is always the right mix of attentiveness and consideration. Most of all the prices are a value for the quality (but not on the lowest end of the spectrum).  My verdict is if you are looking for a great place to have sushi ESPECIALLY if you're lucky enough to be in the area, you must RUN not walk to I Love Sushi.

Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: Very good, very fresh and very fast. Not too expensive and worth every penny.  The edamame appetizer and cucumber appetizers that were complimentary and I would order the cucumber appetizer even if it was expensive because it is dynamite. I had the flower roll which was delicious. The roll list is a little overwhelming at first but many awesome options. The sashimi was great. Well worth the trip.

Reviews.Author: Reverend-Jason
Reviews.Content: In a city where a sushi joint dots every single corner I love sushi is a true standout. The variety of rolls and sushi is unmatched by sushi joints in Las Vegas. Sitting at the sushi bar is always a good time. The sushi the chefs can do saki bombs with you and feel like part of your party.  Although they don't offer  all you can eat  like most places in town, I love sushi doesn't need to run promotions like that and the place is always packed. The service and food make people come back time and time again. Check it out be sure to try the MC roll, Japanese lasagna and the screaming orgasm.

Reviews.Author: Saba
Reviews.Content: Omg! I love sushi is fantastic.  Best  sushi place ever. I can't wait to go there next time. I have been going there for many years they are alway consistent whit quality and taste. My all time favorite there is crazy horse , Japanese lasagna

Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Ate there a few months ago with another couple. Food was veggie dish. The dish was almost 60 % onions. Told server and her only response was sorry. Told he manager on the way out. He said sorry. Nothing off the bill but told me  to let him know next time we came in and he would take care of an item.  NO thanks. Won't be back.  If you are looking for Japanese try the South Point casino.

Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I love Sushi!  The name of this place is exactly what I say mid-meal and post-meal every single time I eat here.   First things first, their entire sushi menu is the best in the world. No joke. The creativity in their rolls is uncanny, no other sushi place compares.   Second, their fish is fresh. Absolutely freshest i've had in Las Vegas.   Third, their uni shooter is heaven in a shot glass. The best mixture of uni, spice and citrus that tickle every inch of your palate.  Our go-to order is the  Screaming orgasm , Uni shooters, a few pieces of sashimi and a roll or two. We try to order a new roll every time we go. Definitely my favorite place to get sushi in Vegas, if not the US.

Reviews.Author: Dina
Reviews.Content: #102 Sun Devin is a must! Other favorites #69 tiger roll, #81 Chris Special, #99 John Homes

Reviews.Author: Nar
Reviews.Content: this place is incredible. i love the towel they give you to wipe down your hands when you're first seated! Love the food (they have funny names for them). Fish is definitely fresh and customer service is EXCELLENT!!

Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite sushi place, period. Since first coming here 2 years ago, everywhere else I go for sushi is almost disappointing in comparison. The rolls are large and the fish is fresh. The waitresses wear kimonos which is super cute and are always friendly.   My personal favorite roll is the Kiss of Fire. The Japanese Lasagna is also a must try.

Reviews.Author: Khrissy
Reviews.Content: Did not live up to my expectations! Jackpot roll was highly recommended and supposedly their best roll, but it tasted like a basic roll. If u want real sushi, head down to SD:)

Reviews.Author: Ean
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this place have to be fake. The place is dirty, service was slow and very polite or attentive almost as if you owe them something for going there. Additionally the rolls are sloppy, too much rice and sauces. There are much better places in Vegas to go then this place!

Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: As good as it gets.  Fresh sushi. Awesome service.  Awesome menu.  The sushi chefs are friendly. The owner is friendly. The wait staff is friendly.  Did I mention the food is awesome too?  This might be the best restaurant in Vegas period.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: I Love Sushi is OK.  Not bad, but really just ok.  I've had so many people tell me its so good and...eh.  I was totally underwhelmed when I went.  It's definitely a cute place, and their menu is huge.  But the menu items aren't that different from each other.  I found myself flipping the menu over a bunch to see what the difference between a couple rolls were.  I think it would be good if you are going with a large group and you're more concerned with having fun than eating awesome sushi.

Reviews.Author: Talia
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite non-AYCE sushi places.  It's so close to my house!  The sushi is super fresh--it glistens, like it came straight out of the water, sliced up, and jumped right onto your plate! haha! When it comes to sashimi and nigiri, they give you thick, fresh cuts of fish.  This is the only place in the city that I've been to that has THE freshest tasting uni (if you have any suggestions otherwise, please comment ;)).  I could eat a million orders of their uni.   Service is cool.  The ambiance is casual.  I suggest sitting up at the sushi bar cuz those dudes are awesome.  I'm not gonna leave a super long review, because people have already raved about this place.  The rolls are great, appetizers are great--THE FOOD IS GREAT. LOL. Just go, you won't be disappointed.  It's worth the $$, especially if you enjoy good quality sushi.

Reviews.Author: Ohana
Reviews.Content: (Brown rice sushi) I love I love sushi even though this place is packed on weekends!! It's worth the wait. I am trying to be health conscious when I can be so I love that they can make sushi with brown rice. I don't know any other sushi joint in Henderson or Vegas that can make sushi with brown rice. Their fish is always fresh tasting. The waitresses are nice. Sometimes I get a little rude attitude when it's super busy, but it's OK. If someone know other good places that can make brown rice, please let me know.

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Bomb af! Food came in fast which is always a plus and was magically delicious. Finished all of it and my stomach went from 0 to 100 real quick. The waitress was on top of her shiet! Always checked on us and always came through with that we needed. I almost wanted to call her  bae . In addition to that the atmosphere of the place made me feel asian af, and I love that. Definitely coming back!

Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: Being new to Henderson and dreading the drive all the way to Summerlin for my otherwise fav sushi place, we found this on Yelp and couldn't help but notice all the rave reviews. Dined in on a Tuesday night. Luckily we beat the dinner rush because when we left, there was a line and a wait to get in. The food was absolutely delish and they had all my favorites!! Everything is reasonably priced and the environment is clean and authentic. Even the wait staff wear kimono's- Nice touch! I love that the tables for 2 are wide so it was comfortable even when we had 5+ plates on the table. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: Great sushi, very fresh, sashimi so buttery...

Reviews.Author: Lloyd
Reviews.Content: Great food and an amazingly helpful owner who will walk you through all of the food options for both newbies and veteran sushi eaters alike.

Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Yakitori is really good here, the miso is soso, and the rest looked good, but i don't like sushi..the staff is really nice and all in all a fun place.

Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: Great change of pace from the countless AYCE places in town. You can definitely taste the difference in both quality and freshness of the fish.

Reviews.Author: Dynaasty
Reviews.Content: The name says it all!! I DO love sushi!  Great staff and I love to seeing the owner there! Favorite roll?? Well, there are many to choose from with cute names!! But my fav? The MC roll...

Reviews.Author: Hannah
Reviews.Content: Good sushi, overwhelming menu, great atmosphere, great service! Fun every time. :)

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: We had ordered a udon and the chicken was so dry we couldn't eat it. The sushi was ok, but not great. The owner was raising his voice to the nice woman that helped us when we asked for some sort of discount for the chicken udon, since we didn't and couldn't eat it. In the past they have been ok, but pushy to get us out. We were very disappointed. This will be our last time we eat here.

Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: There are many sushi restaurants in town that are pretty good, but it's rare to find one with excellent food and great ambience.  All the waitresses are dressed in kimonos and the inside is decorated in a way that makes you feel like your in Asia. The food is even better than the ambience.  A couple menu items I would recommend off the bat is the oyster shooter and the toro.  It may be pricey but it's definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Yes, This place is that good!   Great service, excellent dinner.  Great price.   Check out the Rock N Roll.  They also offer Soy paper which is great too.  Check this place out, but be prepared for a small wait on busy nights.

Reviews.Author: Shanelle
Reviews.Content: Ordered the Japanese burrito and the spicy tuna roll. Was not a fan of the spicy tuna only because it had green onions in it and I hate green onions. The tuna was very fresh tasting. Melted in my mouth!

Reviews.Author: Bernie
Reviews.Content: I Love Sushi! I really do and I love this place.  Got here late on a Sunday night around 10PM and was seated promptly with my family.  Ordered a few rolls:  - Salmon Lovers Roll. Probably the best roll we had. The salmon just melts in your mouth and it's wrapped around a thick piece of avocado.  The sauce was light enough to enjoy and not too overpowering. We liked it so much we got another one.  There's no rice in this one.  - Screaming Orgasm. Seared Ahi. What more can you ask. Fish was fresh. Sauce was good in this one as well. Available in small or large orders.  - Washington Roll.  I wasn't too much of a fan of this roll.  There was something about the consistency that didn't go right. It felt like too much was going on.  - Mountain Roll.  I for one really loved this roll. It's a california roll topped with salmon and baked.  Loved the sauce on this one.  - Honey Roll.  Deep Fried. This was tasty. Not the best roll we had but not the worse roll.  - Tempura Udon.  Someone in my party had this. I had a few bites and thought it was okay.  I love how they give free edamame.  Overall, I would come back here again if I was in town.

Reviews.Author: Niki
Reviews.Content: I've had a really hard time finding a good sushi spot in Vegas. Too be honest freaks me out a bit (we don't have an ocean lol) but I heard this place from a friend so I went to try it out. It was amazing! Really fresh fish and awesome rolls. There is an older man who is so cute he owns the place and he is there everyday. He seats you and checks on your through your meal. The staff wears kimonos and look very traditional, the place looks  crowded  at first but you warm up to its cozy vibe. I ordered albacore sushi and a baked lobster roll, so good. They are really good with food preferences and allergies too, I'm allergic to mushrooms and my roll had it in it so they made it without them. My sister had the mountain roll and it comes in a little pyramid and it has salmon and crab! This place is now my go to for sushi!

Reviews.Author: Hendrick
Reviews.Content: I came here from out of town when I visited my friend. This place is delicious! Even though Vegas is nowhere near large bodies of water, the fish seemed really fresh.  Their service was good and friendly, and I liked that my cup of tea never went empty. Prices were reasonable as well, especially given the quality. You can't beat the names of their rolls. The specialty rolls are HUGE. My friend and I were stuffed sharing two specialty rolls and a maki roll.  If you're in Las Vegas and in the mood for Japanese food, make your way to I Love Sushi if you can!

Reviews.Author: Kathrine
Reviews.Content: Great lunch with my mom. Excellent service, excellent food, decent prices. Recommended!

Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: Terrible. I'm surprised the reviews of this place are so good. The rolls tasted like mayonnaise. Straight up mayo. No rice, no fish, no nothing. I politely told the waitress and she could have cared less. Only come here if you want mayo with a side of rice. Gross.

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: This place has been a must ever time we are in Vegas.  15 minutes from the strip out in Henderson which works well since we have friends that live out that way.  We have never been disappointed and the pricing is amazing compared to other Sushi places we've been around the country.  Half the fun is reading the chef's special menu with all the crazy roll names.  We definitely have our favorites like Kiss of Fire, the classic Rainbow Roll, and Crunch Roll but have to try a few exotics every time.  This trip was the Boom Boom Nipple Special, very good and became the war cry for the weekend.  LOL  Trust me and give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.  My only suggestion would be shorter glasses for Saki Bombs instead of the mugs they use, but that's not a big deal.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: My Favorite Local Sushi Place on the East side. I Love Sushi is always on the tongue of my friends when we are craving some raw goodness. You can always get fresh sushi here, and they have a really extensive menu of fun rolls and dishes. I love the screaming orgasm, yes, this is what its called, I know.  Its yummy ahi tuna with a nice sauce over little cellophane noodles. The place is always pretty busy and I try to go at non peak hours...(read: super late lunch as I always do) so the service is quick.  This is not a super discount sushi place nor is it crazy expensive. I like this in the middle feeling.

Reviews.Author: Debi
Reviews.Content: This is not AyCE but truly and enjoyable reasonably priced meal. The service was exceptional. Nice decor. Large portions. Highly recommend

Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: Very fresh and amazing service. I love the decor too. The seared tuna is truly amazing. Highly recommend going

Reviews.Author: Jenni
Reviews.Content: Best Japanese food in Vegas by far.  Before I even get to saying how amazing the food was I will start with the atmosphere. We got sat at a table with walls around it so it was almost like having our own room. The waitresses wear traditional Japanese garments and speak very little English. It's considered casual but you would look a little under dressed if you showed up in board shorts and flip flops. It is a very cool setup and added to the experience.   Now about the amazing food. Sadly enough I didn't try the sushi but I did get the vegetable tempura which was absolutely amazing. Hands down the best I have ever had. My sister got the chicken Lo mein and it had such an amazing flavor to it I wanted to eat her whole meal! My boyfriend got the platter with shrimp tempura and teriyaki chicken. It was huge and he loved it. I think he picked the best thing on the menu!   Overall it was amazing and definetly will be a returning customer.

Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: Fabulous sushi, wonderful. The food was excellent, and the atmosphere was very authentic. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: I have been to I Love Sushi many times. I always try to go with someone who is more knowledgeable about ordering sushi than I am. This time I went with my adult daughter, who frequently eats sushi in LA, her home. When it came time to order, I prevailed on her to go with a  boat.  We ordered the sushi boat for 2 with 3 of us eating. The meal started with miso soup and a small salad - both tasty. The portion of food in the boat was huge, more than enough food for 3, with a nice variety of sushi and sashimi. Everything tasted fresh. The service was attentive despite the restaurant being very crowded and all the tables full. I will be returning soon.

Reviews.Author: Mirit
Reviews.Content: The sushi menu is plentiful, with lots of choices. Whether you want Sashimi, plain rice and fish, or really cool roll creations, this place has it. The fish is fresh and delicious. I know sushi, and this place is really good! There are rolls that I do not care for, yet only because I do not like the taste of some of the ingredients, while my friends think those are the bomb!  The service is very friendly, and the atmosphere is a happy one.  I have been here 7 times, and plan on continuing to go back. Easy to park and relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Kelli
Reviews.Content: Hands down my favorite sushi spot. You must try the screaming orgasm, the I love sushi special roll, and the Grand Canyon roll. There are many others that are just as fabulous. The menu is huge- you could order something different every time. Service is great. Prices reasonable. Since finding this place I don't go anywhere else for sushi.

Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Every time they deliver the goods. 100% of the time we are in Vegas we come here. No ifs, ands, or buts

Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: AMAZING!!!!!! Ruined all other Sushi places for me. Bitter-sweet cause it is still sooooo good!

Reviews.Author: Kristi
Reviews.Content: This place has the best Sushi in town. There's usually a little bit of a wait on the weekends, but it's so worth it! My favorites: The Screaming Orgasm & the Japanese Lasagna!

Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: I've always heard of this place but never tried it. We came in during dinner time and they were packed. We were seated at the bar. Our sushi chef was friendly and nice.  We typically like to eat sashimi/nigiri. The selection of special fish are limited. Our go to is uni and it was nice and fresh here. We ordered the toro (fatty tuna) and it melted in your mouth. Other than that, everything else here was standard. The fish is fresh here because they stay busy. We also tried the oyster shooter and the uni shooter. I really didn't like it because it was salty, maybe it was the ponzu sauce? We had one roll, I think it was the Joe's roll? It was good.  I don't think this will be my go to place but I would come back.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: Great food and authentic japanese style...lots of action and friendly with chefs. Nice big bar to sit and watch your creations. Awesome roll selection.

Reviews.Author: claire
Reviews.Content: Seriously freaking love this place.  I try to come here whenever i can, usually the weekends when frankie is working.  Best sushi you can get in town hands down.  The service is awesome as well.  Even though its a loud and rowdy atmosphere, its part of the sushi dining experience.  I usually only order 2 rolls, but they really hit the spot.  HIGHLY Recommended.  Order ryans special, its amazing!

Reviews.Author: Monique
Reviews.Content: I love I love sushi.  I've taken out-of-town guests there 3 or 4 times, and all have left with little japanese food babies and big smiles.  You can miss it easily, as it's tucked into the back of a strip mall...with one tiny little sign to let you know where to turn.  But if you miss it, keep circling until you find it...it's worth it.  Consistently fresh sushi, and reasonable prices.  Great, dark wood decor, with serving staff in full traditional dress.  I always feel like I'm on a little fantastic voyage away from Vegas when I step in here.  Service isn't as great as some others in the valley, but the price is right, so I can cope with a little less butt-kissing.  One of my top sushi picks in the city.  Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome! The waitress was dressed in a kimono and the place had great ambiance. I felt like I was transported to Japan. We ordered California Roll and Spider Roll plus a Miso Soup for less than 20 bucks! I will be coming back here again soon!

Reviews.Author: Chelsea
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I'm surprised by all the great reviews for this place. I will say, the service and the atmosphere are lovely, and very well done. The food itself is not great, and I found the quality of the fish to be poor. We ordered the Poke, the Screaming Orgasm, and an Eel Role. The Poke and  Screaming orgasm were inedible due to the poor quality of the fish. The roll was deep fried, and decent, however we decided not to risk anymore bad fish and move on with our evening. Still looking for a great sushi place in the area.

Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: Always busy and always good, I Love Sushi is close to my house and an excellent late evening choice (they're open till 11PM, later than many places off the strip).  Not my favorite place for sashimi, but they have a great roll selection.  Many people love the Sushi Nachos, but they were gross to me.  Everything else I have tried on the menu is excellent.  An interesting baked roll is the volcano.

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Amazing sushi that is well priced and sure to please! Best spicy tuna handroll I have ever had!!!!

Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite sushi place! Great service and absolutely the best sushi place in Henderson!

Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: This is the best place ever for sushi! Service is excellent and timely. The food is delicious. The ambiance is absolutely the beat ever! Walking in there us like a trip to Japan.  I love all the Geisha Girls and their attire. By far my favorite restaurant ever!
